alert.note: Alert for Cherry; Garden; Grant; Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 29 at 7:14PM CDT until May 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT FOR WESTERN CHERRY...GRANT...NORTHEASTERN GARDEN AND EASTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 613 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Gordon to 15 miles north of Ashby to 14 miles south of Hyannis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Hyannis, Whitman, Ashby, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Duluth, Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Swede Lake, Irwin, Cogill Lake, Rock Hill, Pine Ridge and Hoover Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 89 and 130. Highway 250 between mile markers 41 and 48. Highway 2 between mile markers 124 and 162. Highway 61 between mile markers 138 and 210. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
